title: Stack-based buffer overflow in SSL VPN daemon
summary: Under non-default configuration, a stack-based buffer overflow in FortiGate may allow a remote attacker authenticated to the SSL VPN to crash the FortiClient NAC daemon (fcnacd) and potentially execute arbitrary code via requesting a large FortiClient file name. We are not aware of proof of concept code successfully achieving the latter.

operating_system.description: FortiOS: greater equal 5.6.0, less equal 5.6.12, fixed in 5.6.13, 6.0.11, 6.2.0, 6.4.0
FortiOS: greater equal 6.0.0, less equal 6.0.10, fixed in 5.6.13, 6.0.11, 6.2.0, 6.4.0
